title: Saving with (many) staged changes can produce multiple commits
body:
#### What is the problem?

I used `datalad run` to execute a shell script to convert an mri dataset to a BIDS structure (mostly through moving/renaming files) and it resulted in 6 commit messages.

* all commits had the same run record, but the files that were contained/executed upon in each commit were different
* I did not declare any `inputs` or `outputs` in the `datalad run` call
* the shell script operated on ~22,000+ files.

My assumption is that this is due to the number of files that I'm operating on. Curious on what you guys think.

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?


